subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: Eric VanDuzer
full_text:
Nice explanation I like it probably the best I have heard thank you


On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 12:35 PM, April Abercrombie <
april@abercrombieghostresearch.com> wrote:

>
>
>  2 different things happening-that's why. When you get EVP that everyone
> understands, it is outward, in the environment. Not a communication through
> subconscious means.
>
> EVP that people swear they hear, but noone else can make sense, may be a
> message to them via subconscious means. That isn't to say that ALL EVP's
> like this are true messages, I am sure alot are just matrixing.
>
> But then that is how the art of scrying starts-matrixing. Like the
> Rorschach tests. The images you matrix with those gives the psychologist an
> insight into your mind.
>
> By gazing into a dark, reflective surface, you start to see cloudy images.
> At first, you will just be matrixing faces in the clouds and not getting
> much substance. Try it, you will see what I am saying. With practice, you
> start to see clear, concise images.
>
> I think that is what happening with audio as well.
>
> We already know for a fact pareidolia can occur in audio as well as visual
> stimulus.
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> *From:* Eric VanDuzer <evanduzer@...>
> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> *Sent:* Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:19 AM
> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
>
>  yes I understand its personal to that particular individual but why can't
> I hear it.  I have gotten some very personal EVPs through the traditional
> investigation way (not through a box or anything of that matter) that all
> others have heard.
>
> On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 12:15 PM, April Abercrombie <
> april@...> wrote:
>
>>
>>
>>  "If one person is not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am
>> not quite ready to believe that one right yet)."
>>
>> I don't know for sure about that one either, but I am not ready to
>> discount it either, especially since I stumbled across the possibility of
>> audible scrying. But I am sure alot of people don't believe in scrying at
>> all either.
>>
>> What makes it a possibility to me is that so many people are hearing
>> things that are very personal, but stuff they would not have come up with on
>> their own.
>>
>>
>>
>>  ----- Original Message -----
>> *From:* Eric VanDuzer <evanduzer@...>
>>  *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>>  *Sent:* Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:09 AM
>> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
>>
>>  I think that is the problem I am having though Jim.  When you say "work
>> them over till you hear them"  to me I should not have to work them over
>> till I hear them.  Yes taking out the ambient and background noise is one
>> thing.  But if you just keep on listening to them with different
>> enhancements you are bound to hear something (matrixing).  If one person is
>> not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to
>> believe that one right yet).  I think you all know what I am getting at.
>>
>> On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdryve@...>wrote:
>>
>>>
>>>
>>> Well, for myself...I don't "clean" them up to much because I really don't
>>> know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've only been at it for a couple
>>> weeks. BUT if you can clean up something to where you can FIND what was
>>> there to begin with "you have done no harm" I hear alot more than others I
>>> guess, and I haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If anyone is able to clean
>>> them up...I DO promise you will hear what I say is correct)Pretty BOLD
>>> statement, but if you are able to clean it up with better software (please
>>> do for others too) I will be more than happy to "listen" where I made a
>>> mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have done some DEEP enhancements to
>>> a few of my evp's...from the begining I could only hear clicks and
>>> thumps.....but after messing with that area, eventually I would hear the
>>> true voices (and can tell if male or female...approximate age) and
>>> understand the mood also....these where extreamly modified, and I feel that
>>> I could NOT have added enough "simple" enhancements that would ADD a
>>> voice....full of emotion and distinct syllables :) And some just can't hear
>>> them for what ever reason be it equipment that is used to hear
>>> (pc-headphones-speakers-ears) know one has the perfect match of all these
>>> things. Check out "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" in the files section....work them
>>> over till you hear them. I really can't do much more :)--- In
>>> EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Eric VanDuzer
>>> <evanduzer@...> wrote:
>>> >
>>> > Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way of doing things. I do
>>> clean
>>> > up evps if I hear something and can't make it out do to ambient noise.
>>> So
>>> > hear is my question. When do you stop cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
>>> > enhancing "taint" the results? To me the more enhancing you do the less
>>> > convincing it becomes. I hope noone finds this offensive, it is not
>>> meant
>>> > to be I am just really curious. The way I look at it is that if you
>>> have to
>>> > do so much enhancing to find anything, was there really something there
>>> to
>>> > begin with. Are we just making ourselves believe there is something
>>> there??
>>> >
>>> > Eric
>>> >
>>>
>>>
>>
>   
>
